com.roscopeco.ormdroid

Class ORMDroidApplication

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.content.Context
      • android.content.ContextWrapper
        • android.app.Application
          • com.roscopeco.ormdroid.ORMDroidApplication
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2

    public class ORMDroidApplication
extends android.app.Application

    Provides static-initialization for the ORMDroid framework. The initialize(Context) method must be called with a valid Context prior to using any framework methods that reference the default database.

    Note that this class extends Application, allowing you to set it as the Application class in your manifest to have this initialization handled automatically.

    • Method Detail

      • isInitialized

        public static boolean isInitialized()

      • initialize

        public static void initialize(android.content.Context ctx)

        Intialize the ORMDroid framework. This must be called before using any of the methods that use the default database.

        If your application doesn't use the default database (e.g. you pass in your own SQLiteDatabase handle to the Query.execute(SQLiteDatabase) and Entity.save(SQLiteDatabase) methods) the you don't technically need to call this, but it doesn't hurt.

        This method may be called multiple times - subsequent calls are simply ignored.

        Parameters:
        ctx - A Context within the application to initialize.

      • getSingleton

      • getDefaultDatabase

        public static android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase getDefaultDatabase()
        Obtain the default database used by the framework. This is a convenience that calls getDatabase() on the singleton instance.
        Returns:
        the default database.
